trans-unit.source: Retrieves the text from a standard status bar control.

seg-source.mrk: Retrieves the text from a standard status bar control.

target.mrk: Retrieves the text from a standard status bar control.

trans-unit.source: The title/hWnd/class of the window to check.

seg-source.mrk: The title/hWnd/class of the window to check.

target.mrk: The title/hWnd/class of the window to check.

trans-unit.source: [optional] The text of the window to check. Default is an empty string.

seg-source.mrk: The text of the window to check.

target.mrk: The text of the window to check.

trans-unit.source: [optional] The "part" number of the status bar to read - the default is 1. 1 is the first possible part and usually the one that contains the useful messages like "Ready" "Loading...", etc.

seg-source.mrk: The "part" number of the status bar to read - the default is 1.
1 is the first possible part and usually the one that contains the useful messages like "Ready" "Loading...", etc.

target.mrk: The "part" number of the status bar to read - the default is 1.
1 is the first possible part and usually the one that contains the useful messages like "Ready" "Loading...", etc.

trans-unit.source: "" (empty string) and sets the @error flag to 1 if no text could be read.

seg-source.mrk: "" (empty string) and sets the @error flag to 1 if no text could be read.

target.mrk: "" (empty string) and sets the @error flag to 1 if no text could be read.

trans-unit.source: This functions attempts to read the first standard status bar on a window (Microsoft common control: msctls_statusbar32). Some programs use their own status bars or special versions of the MS common control which StatusbarGetText() cannot read. For example, StatusbarGetText does not work on the program TextPad; however, the first region of TextPad's status bar can be read using ControlGetText("TextPad", "", "HSStatusBar1")

seg-source.mrk: This functions attempts to read the first standard status bar on a window (Microsoft common control: msctls_statusbar32).
Some programs use their own status bars or special versions of the MS common control which StatusbarGetText() cannot read.
For example, StatusbarGetText does not work on the program TextPad; however, the first region of TextPad's status bar can be read using ControlGetText("TextPad", "", "HSStatusBar1")

target.mrk: This functions attempts to read the first standard status bar on a window (Microsoft common control: msctls_statusbar32).
Some programs use their own status bars or special versions of the MS common control which StatusbarGetText() cannot read.
For example, StatusbarGetText does not work on the program TextPad; however, the first region of TextPad's status bar can be read using ControlGetText("TextPad", "", "HSStatusBar1")

trans-unit.source: StatusbarGetText() can work on windows that are minimized or even hidden.

seg-source.mrk: StatusbarGetText() can work on windows that are minimized or even hidden.

target.mrk: StatusbarGetText() can work on windows that are minimized or even hidden.
